Package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.retry

Class RetryConditionImpl<T>

java.lang.Object
io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.retry.RetryConditionImpl<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of value produced by the function and evaluated by the condition.
All Implemented Interfaces:
RetryCondition<T>
public class RetryConditionImpl<T> extends Object implements RetryCondition<T>
A concrete implementation of RetryCondition for flexible retry logic.

This class defines how a particular retry condition is formed by pairing a Function (producing the value to be tested) with a Predicate (evaluating whether the produced value meets the desired condition).

Instances of this class are typically created with references to the actual service or context that will be invoked repeatedly, along with the success criteria that must be satisfied for the retry to end.

      Parameters:
      function - The function that produces a value of type T for evaluation.

  • Method Details

    • function

      public Function<Object,T> function()
      Produces a value to be evaluated by the retry logic.

      This function is typically called repeatedly by a retry mechanism until the result satisfies the corresponding RetryCondition.condition().

      Specified by:
      function in interface RetryCondition<T>
      Returns:
      a Function that takes an Object (e.g., a service or context) and returns a value of type T for evaluation.

    • condition

      public Predicate<T> condition()
      Evaluates the value produced by RetryCondition.function() to determine success.

      If this predicate returns true, the retry mechanism can stop. Otherwise, the retry mechanism continues to invoke function() until a timeout is reached.

      Specified by:
      condition in interface RetryCondition<T>
      Returns:
      a Predicate that tests the value of type T for success.
